What powers does the Moderator, Global Moderator, and SQUAD Staff member have? Like are there any differences between them?

> 
> 
> 9 hours ago, The\_Cat\_In\_Space said:
> 
> 
> What powers does the Moderator, Global Moderator, and SQUAD Staff member have? Like are there any differences between them?
> 

There was a time when Globals could merge duplicate accounts and change usernames, but I think only Admins can do that now (you don't see much of them, I suppose). Global Moderators and Moderators have the same power in terms of forum software, but we defer to the globals when it comes to hairy decisions. Staff Members, AFAIK, have no moderating power, but some of them are *also* moderators.

> 
> 
> On 2/1/2018 at 7:53 PM, The\_Cat\_In\_Space said:
> 
> 
> What powers does the Moderator, Global Moderator, and SQUAD Staff member have? Like are there any differences between them?
> 

- Moderators have the power to maintain the forum.  Move / hide posts, issue warns, approve queued posts.
- Global Moderators are like Moderators, but grumpier.
- SQUAD Staff have the power to make KSP.

![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif ":)")

In practice, most "SQUAD Staff" accounts have nothing to do with running the forums (nor do they want to), because it's not their job and they've got other stuff to do to keep them busy.  Some "Squad Staff", however, are specifically concerned with the running of the forums and doing whatever is needed there-- specifically our community leads [@Darth Badie](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/149302-darth-badie/) and [@UomoCapra](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/167737-uomocapra/) (who are the ultimate authority regarding anything involving *<u>policy</u>* and *<u>rules</u>*), and [@ManeTI](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/167672-maneti/) (who's on the technical side of things, and responsible for the care and feeding of the forum software).   And [@technicalfool](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/70430-technicalfool/), who wears a moderator's hat despite also being Squad staff, apparently because he's a glutton for punishment.

I dids dah maths! ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif ":D")

As of 2018-02-02:

7635 pages of members, each page with 24 members, for a count of roughly 183,240

Of these 183,240, only 2483 pages (59,592) of members have at least ONE post.

Which means that there are roughly 5152 pages worth of members (123,648 members in total) which have not posted at all. It looks like most of these have no profile pictures, and logged in only once, when they created their account.

Slightly more active members: Only 741 pages worth of members (17,784) have at least 10 posts. A lot of these still have no profile pictures, and have little to no reputation.  Many haven't logged on in a long, long time.

Now, members with at least 100 posts:

186 pages worth of members have at least 100 posts. This amounts to about 4,464 members, which isn't very much. About half have profile pictures, but a significant amount of them are inactive.

From the first of January, 2017, to the first of January, 2018, there have been 10,848 new members. Sadly, I can't seem to be able to organize them by post count this time around ![:(](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_sad.gif ":(") Roughly 29-30 new members every day.

First of January, 2016, to first of January, 2017, saw 15,768 new members. Roughly 43 new people every day.

First of January, 2015, to first of January, 2016, saw 21,690 new members. Roughly 59-60 new people every day

I think there's a trend ![:/](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/ZNGIcon1.png ":/")

But there's your daily dose of statistics ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif ":)") (I'm a big fan of stats. Idk why lol)

Some stats might be inaccurate. I didn't double check ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif ":P")
